result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrow C Bonner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence of Illinois case
COURT HAS NO OBJECTION TO INTERSTATE COMPACT ALLOWING TRANSFER OF SUPERVISION TO ILLINOIS

miscConds.notes: DNA sample to be taken from defendant.  Court ordered re-payment of extradition costs of $37.59 to the Wisconsin Office of the District Attorney. Court sentence defendant to all costs, penalties and surcharges including DNA surcharge and extradition costs to be paid by the end of probation. If revoked, to be collected by the DOC at a rate deemed appropriate, any balance as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. Cash bail applied.

- Seek and maintain employment of at least 30 hours a week within 60 days of release.
- Obtain GED or HSED in the first year of probation.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s.941.29(1m) or (4m).

- No use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No contact with persons in possession of controlled substances.
- Meet regularly and cooperate fully with probation agent.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrow C Bonner

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 08/15/19.
Bail Refund Check Packet.  sb

Defendant Darrow C Bonner in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Matter scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS; consecutive to sentence of Illinois case; with credit for 36 days time served.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 4 YEARS. The Court has no objection to interstate compact allowing transfer of supervision to Illinois.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION / EXTENDED SUPERVISION
*No use or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription. 
*No contact with persons in possession of controlled substances.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
*Random urine screens. 
*Seek and maintain employment of at least 30 hours a week within 60 days of release.
*Obtain GED or HSED in the first year of probation.
*Meet regularly and cooperate fully with probation agent.

Court ordered repayment of extradition costs of $37.59 to the Wisconsin Office of the District Attorney. Costs to be paid by the end of probation. If revoked, to be collected by the DOC at a rate deemed appropriate, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Court ordered a DNA sample to be taken from Defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to all costs, penalties and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) to be paid by the end of probation. If revoked, to be collected by the DOC at a rate deemed appropriate, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Extradition Report, Photograph.
Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant, received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Darrow C Bonner in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Alex Mueller on behalf of Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Matter scheduled for Plea Hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court REITERATED condition of bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
